timeline.bodyText:
Huh, contrary to my comment on #3633 it looks like we weren't pinning this action version by SHA. 🤷‍♂️ 😄
As such, I'll suggest:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  - uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@v5.13.0
          
          
            
                  - uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@4d1215c #v5.13.0
timeline.author: rnorth
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -9,6 +9,6 @@ jobs:
   update_release_draft:
     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     steps:
-      - uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@v5.9.0
+      - uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@v5.13.0

replies.bodyText: technically that is also mutable since you can use force push to remove that commit sha. 😅
replies.author: jetersen

replies.bodyText:
True, but the attack we're trying to avoid with pinned SHAs is malicious alteration of a tag - GitHub Actions have a lot of power. Of course I'm not suggesting that you or the other committers would do that, but having a general approach of always-pinned lets us sleep easier at night.
We don't care so much if a SHA is removed (and GC'd by GitHub) - breakage like that is easy to detect and deal with.
replies.author: rnorth

timeline.message:
use commit sha

Co-authored-by: Richard North <rich.north@gmail.com>
